document.bingtitle: Ordering Kiosk at Jack-in-the-Box » Coolest Gadgets
document.description: Still, I always had “cashier at fast food restaurant” as my back up plan for retirement. ... Drinking Gadgets (188) E-book readers (36) Eco Gadgets (551) Electronic ...
document.body:
Coolest Gadgets - the ongoing search for the coolest gadget continues... Signup Via RSS Coolest Gadgets on Facebook Coolest Gadgets on Twitter Home Contact About Advertise
Get email alerts « Win $50 in Coolest Gadget of the Week Motion-Sensitive Remote Control » Electronic Gadgets Ordering Kiosk at Jack-in-the-Box by Mark R Sometimes I can’t help but wonder if technology has caused this current economic crisis. Did consumers go into debt to buy tech devices that they just “had to have”? Worse yet, did all those labor saving inventions remove the need for human workers?
Well, I can tell you one job that may not require a human anymore: the fast-food cashier. Like the self-checkout stands that you see at your local grocer or the ATM at your bank, this kiosk that you see to the left removes the human from the fast-food equation.
I am guessing that the screen that says “order and pay here” is a full touchscreen, and you can choose from a menu of food options. Paying is probably done with credit cards and feeding dollars in the slots. I don’t see any place for coins.
In all honesty, I can think of ten good reasons to avoid human interaction with a fast-food cashier. Most of them are young people who don’t really care about serving customers, or old people like Squidward Tentacles from Spongebob Squarepants .
Still, I always had “cashier at fast food restaurant” as my back up plan for retirement. If there is a machine that can do the job, all I have to say is this: Uh-oh.

5 reviews or comments
JProff Says: July 25, 2009 at 12:14 pm
This has been at our local Jack In the Box for almost 2 years now, not sure why coolest gadgets just heard of it. But it does make me question how in-the-know they are if I knew of something 2 years before they did.
StonzTwo Says: July 27, 2009 at 5:57 am
i kinda agree with you jproff…they had several of these kiosks at a subway in LA when I was down there for an internship in the summer of’05.
Dice_Girl Says: July 28, 2009 at 7:57 am
I use to live in Stockton, Ca and never saw anything like this. I now live in Denver, CO and I still have never seen anything like this. I guess these just aren’t widespread or I am not going to the cool fast food resturants.
porter Says: July 29, 2009 at 3:53 pm
coolest gadgets is very slow we have had one of these at our carls jr. for 2 years at elk city, ok
